Bogatsi od króla? Jak bardzo zamożna była polska magnateria?

results:
Based on the search results, I found comprehensive information about Polish noble families, their feuds, and conflicts involving the Radziwiłł and Potocki families. Here's what the search revealed:

## Polish Noble Family Feuds and Magnate Conflicts

The magnate families were constantly involved in arrangements or disputes with each other, and they also intermarried to maintain their noble lineage. After the second side of the dispute stood the old nobility camp with the Branicki and Potocki families at the head.

### The Radziwiłł Family

The Radziwiłłs were "everywhere." This magnate family, known since the 15th century, was very versatile. For several hundred years it belonged to the most influential in the Polish-Lithuanian state, providing it with hetmans, chancellors, bishops... They were virtually unsinkable, although in a scandalous atmosphere they brought about the marriage of Barbara Radziwiłłówna with King Sigismund Augustus, in Lithuania they discouraged the Sapieha and Pac families, and during the Swedish Deluge Janusz and Bogusław Radziwiłł were branded as traitors.(no content)The first ordination in Poland was created by the Radziwiłłs in 1586, three years later the Zamoyski ordination was established.

### The Potocki Family

Both noble and disreputable Potockis distinguished themselves in history. Some of them opposed the Family party led by the Czartoryskis. They were considered an anti-Russian faction that disrupted sejms.

### Magnate Conflicts and Political Divisions

One of the most distinguished magnate families were the Czartoryskis, patrons of art, educated strategists and authors of reforms. Together with the Poniatowskis, they founded the Family, an opposition party to King Augustus III of Saxony. On the other side of the dispute stood the old nobility camp with the Branicki and Potocki families at the head.

### Honor and Family Feuds

Not to mention the bronze cannons kept in the family castle in Żółkiew, deterring opponents. Weapons could always be useful to magnates - not only in defending the country, but also to protect their property from creditors (and they had considerable debts) or... to quickly occupy the estates of a deceased relative.

### The Magnate System

Individual magnate families developed their own system of noble clientele, through which they elected their own candidates to the sejm, deputies of the Crown Tribunal and the Main Tribunal of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania, controlled sejmiks and land courts.(no content)The most important criteria for belonging to the magnate class were: possessed wealth, held royal estates, existing marriages, held offices, a specific lifestyle - maintaining a court and armed force. Representatives of magnate families held the most prestigious dignities and offices, which, based on personal wealth and their families' influence, gave them real power.

The search results reveal that Polish magnate families like the Radziwiłłs and Potockis were deeply involved in political conflicts, family feuds over inheritance, and power struggles that often involved maintaining private armies and forming political factions that could influence royal elections and parliamentary decisions.
